props.name: options
props.description: The options of the client.

props.name: accessToken
props.description: The access token which will be used to make requests to the Jellyfin API

props.name: serverId
props.description: The server identifier

props.name: user
props.description: The connected user of the client.

methods.name: login
methods.description:
Authenticate to the Jellyfin server

<warn>The parameters should be kept private at all times.</warn>
<info>You should use environment variables to keep it private.</info>

<info>When authenticated, a {@link Client#ready} event is fired, you can also use promises like `then()` or `await` if you don't want to use events.</info>

params.name: username
params.description: The username of the user to authenticate

params.name: password
params.description: The password of the user to authenticate

params.name: baseUrl
params.description: The base URL of the Jellyfin server

methods.name: logout
methods.description:
Disconnects from the Jellyfin server

<info>When disconnected, a {@link Client#disconnected} event is fired, you can also use promises like `then()` or `await` if you don't want to use events.</info>

methods.name: apiReq
methods.description: Do an API request, this is not recommended to use

returns.description: A promise that resolves to the API response

classes.name: Client
classes.description: Instantiates a new client. This is the entry point.

props.name: options
props.description: The options of the client.

props.name: accessToken
props.description: The access token which will be used to make requests to the Jellyfin API

props.name: serverId
props.description: The server identifier

props.name: user
props.description: The connected user of the client.

params.name: includeHidden
params.description: Whether or not to include hidden content.

params.name: includeExternalContent
params.description: Whether or not to include external views such as channels or live tv.

methods.name: login
methods.description:
Authenticate to the Jellyfin server

<warn>The parameters should be kept private at all times.</warn>
<info>You should use environment variables to keep it private.</info>

<info>When authenticated, a {@link Client#ready} event is fired, you can also use promises like `then()` or `await` if you don't want to use events.</info>

params.name: username
params.description: The username of the user to authenticate

params.name: password
params.description: The password of the user to authenticate

params.name: baseUrl
params.description: The base URL of the Jellyfin server

methods.name: logout
methods.description:
Disconnects from the Jellyfin server

<info>When disconnected, a {@link Client#disconnected} event is fired, you can also use promises like `then()` or `await` if you don't want to use events.</info>

methods.name: apiReq
methods.description: Do an API request, this is not recommended to use

returns.description: A promise that resolves to the API response

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the client was authenticated successfully to the Jellyfin server.

events.name: disconnected
events.description: Emitted when the client was disconnected successfully to the Jellyfin server.

events.name: apiRequest
events.description:
Emitted before every API request.
This event can emit several times for the same request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.
<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,
it is highly recommended to check `request.url` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that is about to be sent

events.name: apiResponse
events.description:
Emitted after every API request has received a response.
This event does not necessarily correlate to completion of the request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.
<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,
it is highly recommended to check `request.url` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that triggered this response

params.name: response
params.description: The response received from the API

props.name: client
props.description: The client that created this request

methods.name: do
methods.description: Makes a request to the API

props.name: baseUrl
props.description:
The default Jellyfin URL to use. It must contain the protocol. And should contain a subpath (ended with a slash), if there's one.

If present, this defaults to `process.env.JELLYFIN_URL` when instantiating the client

props.name: username
props.description:
The Jellyfin Username to use.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.JELLYFIN_USERNAME` when instantiating the client

props.name: password
props.description:
The Jellyfin Password to use.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.JELLYFIN_PASSWORD` when instantiating the client

props.name: dev
props.description: Whether is in dev mode (Uses more logging traces in the core).

props.name: clientInfo
props.description: Client Info Options.

props.name: deviceInfo
props.description: Device Info Options.

props.name: defaultOptions
props.description: The base client instance.

classes.name: defaultOptionsClientInfo
classes.description: Represents the client info category in the configuration.

props.name: name
props.description:
The default Client Name to use.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.JELLYFIN_CLIENT_NAME` when instantiating the client

props.name: version
props.description:
The default Client Version to use.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.JELLYFIN_CLIENT_VERSION` when instantiating the client

props.name: defaultOptionsClientInfo
props.description: Default options.

classes.name: defaultOptionsDeviceInfo
classes.description: Represents the device info category in the configuration.

props.name: name
props.description:
The default Client Name to use.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.JELLYFIN_CLIENT_NAME` when instantiating the client,
else this uses "node-jellyfin"

props.name: id
props.description:
The default Device ID to use.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.JELLYFIN_DEVICE_ID` when instantiating the client.
If not, uses the generated UUID used in the postinstall script. If the UUID is not present, it generates a random one.

props.name: defaultOptionsDeviceInfo
props.description: Default options.

functions.name: mergeDefault
functions.description: Sets default properties on an object that aren't already specified.

functions.name: createEnum
functions.description: Create an enum from a list of strings.
